intro: Brachiolobos palustris, commonly known as the marsh fern, is a perennial plant native to wetland environments. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, feather-like fronds. The plant thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in bogs and swampy areas. Its spore-producing structures are located on the underside of its leaves, typical of ferns. Brachiolobos palustris plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various microorganisms.
